TopicTitle: The new 1.0.5 "mouselook" feature: like or not?

Articles.Content:
1.0.5 introduced this new "mouselook" feature, which, when active, causes mouse motion to rotate the camera view while no button is pressed.

Personally, I cannot stand this feature and it drives me up the freaking wall. I'm accidentally triggering it all the time, and it's incredibly jarring every time I do. I never trigger it on purpose, because it's a completely useless feature to me. If I want to rotate the camera, I hold the mouse button down. I don't want it to rotate when I'm not holding a mouse button, because that stops me from clicking on all the things I need to click.

It's actively interfering with my gameplay and I see no way to turn it off. I desperately wish they would get rid of this feature (or at least add a UI option somewhere to disable it).

And yet, I assume Squad must have had some reason for adding the feature. Maybe other people have more of a use for it than I do? Or there's some important use case I'm missing?

What do you think?

Okay, so found out on [URL="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/139663-Backslash-triggers-right-click-view"]another thread[/URL] that you actually can turn it off. Yay! :)
